availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Arnett Ramey (Caldwell County, Ky, farmer, pvt 8th Ky Inf (csa))

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Robert Ramey and Nancy Ladd Ramey. Married to Caroline Ramey. Father of John Ramey. Student in Trigg County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Served in the 8th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from October 24, 1861 to July 17, 1863. Reported as a prisoner of war. Paroled on July 17, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 317B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Long Pond, p. 6.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #10572.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 384-85.
"Andrew Arnett Ramey (1837-1915)," Find A Grave, Memorial #6993945, accessed January 21, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6993945.
